content: bring together all your scrap yarns of different weights to create a blanket your eyes can t help but dance across each square is worked individually making this a perfect meditative project when you re on the go a continuous crochet joining technique brings everything together seamlessly so you re left with fewer ends to weave in and a blanket made with zero sewing this pattern is a perfect way to use up those leftover half skeins you ve been holding onto category 4 worsted weight and category 5 bulky yarn is used for the circles in the pattern but category 3 dk weight yarn can work too you ll need category 4 yarn for the main color the ad-free pdf is formatted for printing and easy reading it includes photo tutorials and links to helpful video tutorials instructions are written to create a throw sized blanket 44 x 53 and details are given for making a smaller baby blanket or twin sized bedspread too you re going to love the sense of accomplishment you feel after finishing each step of this relaxing project this pattern originally appeared on make & do crew skill level -
